Europe's paradoxical support for Israel's attack against Iran
subhead: France, the United Kingdom and Germany expressed their support on Friday for Israel's 'right to defend itself' against the nuclear threat posed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, despite deteriorating relations with Benjamin Netanyahu because of his war in Gaza and their stated preference for a diplomatic approach.

Trump's long-standing obsession with military parades
subhead: More than 6,000 soldiers are set to march in Washington on Saturday to mark the 250th anniversary of the United States Armed Forces. In 2017, the US president was impressed by the July 14 Bastille Day parade on the Champs-Elysées in Paris, to which President Macron had invited him.

title: 'Can robots beat the wolves of Wall Street?'
subhead: According to a study conducted by Stanford University, artificial intelligence has outperformed 93% of US equity mutual fund managers. So it is hardly surprising that the asset management industry is doubling down on technology, observes Le Monde columnist Isabelle Chaperon.

title: In Rome, Maria Grazia Chiuri's final bow
subhead: It was in her hometown that Dior's artistic director, Maria Grazia Chiuri, chose to stage her farewell show on May 27. Though nothing was revealed that day about her departure, the designer decided to celebrate the art and culture of the Italian capital, where she has just brought a small theater back to life near the Forum.

title: The Islamic Republic of Iran, Netanyahu's favorite enemy for 30 years
subhead: Since his rise to prominence on the Israeli political stage in the early 1990s, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has repeatedly insisted that the regime in Tehran poses an 'existential threat' to Israel.

Two Jewish sisters' fight to honor the couple who hid them during the Holocaust
subhead: Arlette and Madeleine Testyler campaigned so that Jeanne and Jean Philippeau, who sheltered them during World War II, be recognized as Righteous Among the Nations. After some hesitation from the mayor, the town of Vendôme is organizing a ceremony on June 16 in which they will be honored by the Yad Vashem Institute.

title: How Donald Trump is using the military for political gain in Los Angeles
subhead: Thousands of soldiers have been deployed in Los Angeles to support the police tasked with arresting undocumented individuals. This unprecedented decision in a major American city has allowed the US president to test the limits of executive power.

title: French-Algerian woman given 48 hours to leave France in incomprehensible deportation order
subhead: A 58-year-old mother, who has been living in France since 1993 and holds dual nationality, was detained for an entire afternoon by border police at a Paris airport. She is contesting the order to leave French territory that was served to her.
